title: [ENH] Cleaning up Catch22 feature extraction transformer
body:
While refactoring, I cam across `Catch22` (a feature extractor comparable to tsfresh).

This looks very useful, but the code is a bit of a mess (old legacy code structure) and should be refactored as follows, imo:

* the estimator needs to comply with the transformer interface, e.g., `transform` moved to `_transform` and input checks removed etc. I've started with that already in #2253
* `_transform` should return a `pd.DataFrame`, with columns being the names in `feature_names`
* `Catch22` should accept a parameter `features` such as used in various functions. This is a `str` or list of `str`, of codes in `feature_names`. If passed, the transformer will calculate only those features.
* `X_inner_mtype` should also accept `pd.DataFrame`, i.e., a single series (in which case no loop is run over instances)
* the docstring should describe all parameters properly.

Good first issue, I think - most of these changes should be straightforward, albeit a bit fiddly.

Bonus: `_transform` works for multivariate input, output `pd.DataFrame` columns are `pd.Multiindex` named `(variable_name, feature_name)`. Not advised to do this in the first PR, this may be fiddly.
